item.title: Faith add a quote by Eva Ibbotson
item.description: "It's true that adventures are good for people even when they are very young. Adventures can get in a person's blood even if he doesn't remember having them. " -- Eva Ibbotson

item.title: Faith add a quote by Clive Barker
item.description: "I dreamt a limitless book, A book unbound, Its leaves scattered in fantastic abundance On every line there was a new horizon drawn, New heavens supposed; New states, new souls." -- Clive Barker

item.title: Faith add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Faith add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I am enough of an artist to draw freely upon my imagination. Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Faith add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Faith add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Faith add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Not all of us can do great things. But we can do small things with great love." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Faith add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Faith add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Reality continues to ruin my life." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Faith add a quote by Randall Jarrell
item.description: "The days went by for him, all different and all the same. The boy was happy, and yet he didn't know that he was happy, exactly: he couldn't remember having been unhappy. If one day as he played at the edge of the forest some talking bird had flown down and asked him: "Do you like your life" he would not have known what to say, but would have asked the bird: "Can you not like it?" -- Randall Jarrell

item.title: Faith add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The reports of my death are greatly exaggerated." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Faith add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Writing is easy. All you have to do is cross out the wrong words." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Faith add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I thoroughly disapprove of duels. If a man should challenge me, I would take him kindly and forgivingly by the hand and lead him to a quiet place and kill him." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Faith add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I am trying here to prevent anyone saying the really foolish thing that people often say about Him: I’m ready to accept Jesus as a great moral teacher, but I don’t accept his claim to be God. That is the one thing we must not say. A man who was merely a man and said the sort of things Jesus said would not be a great moral teacher. He would either be a lunatic — on the level with the man who says he is a poached egg — or else he would be the Devil of Hell. You must make your choice. Either this man was, and is, the Son of God, or else a madman or something worse. You can shut him up for a fool, you can spit at him and kill him as a demon or you can fall at his feet and call him Lord and God, but let us not come with any patronizing nonsense about his being a great human teacher. He has not left that open to us. He did not intend to." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Faith add a quote by Cassandra Clare
Faith add a quote by Alice Hoffman
item.description: "I can hurt myself more than anyone else can, she told her sister. I can do it with my eyes closed." -- Alice Hoffman

item.title: Faith add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Look! A trickle of water running through some dirt! I'd say our afternoon just got booked solid!" -- Bill Watterson
